comments.text:
Created attachment 566461
Dragging a file to desktop creates a shortcut

What did you do?
Went to http://www.ict.swin.edu.au/research/projects/helix/download.html
Dragged one of the Download links and dropped it to desktop

What happened?
A shortcut to the file was created

What should have happened?
The actual file should have been downloaded to the desktop
comments.raw_text:

comments.text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 505030 ***

comments.raw_text: This ticket is different from 505030. Grab a file, and drop it on the desktop or some other folder (not the download manager).
comments.text: This ticket is different from 505030. Grab a file, and drop it on the desktop or some other folder (not the download manager).

comments.author: nielsl@xs4all.nl
comments.text:
(In reply to Hamidables from comment #2)
> This ticket is different from 505030. Grab a file, and drop it on the
> desktop or some other folder (not the download manager).

You misread. This ticket is a dupicate of 505030. It speaks of dropping into a FILE manager. It does not nention a download manager. On Windows machines the default file manager is explorer. Explorer also hosts the desktop. The desktop is an extention of the file manager. Therefore 505030 does cover all aspects of this ticket.
